name: Dragonette with Tiny Sun

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Pop singer-songwriter Dragonette, film composer Jonathan Goldsmith, and The Henrys frontman Don Rooke put their distinctive musical backgrounds together to form a genre-blurring trio united by the playful constraint of crafting songs under two minutes.

Martina Sorbara, better known as the electro-pop outfit Dragonette, has lived multiple musical lifetimes over the past 15 years. A Juno Award-winning artist and sought-after songwriter, Sorbara has scored numerous global hits, including "Pick Up the Phone," "Let it Go," and the chart-topping "Hello" with Martin Solveig.

name: Lens on Life: Honouring Urban Wildlife Webinar
description: Take in an engaging webinar with renowned local nature photographer James Beaton. This session showcases photographs and field stories that reveal the rich biodiversity woven throughout our urban landscape. Learn practical, ethical ways to observe and respect wildlife while still capturing meaningful images.

name: Explorations in Creative Photography
description: Experience natural scenes transformed into unique artistic interpretations using various techniques in camera and post processing in this group photography exhibition by F8 Photography Collective. This exhibition will be part of CONTACT Photography Festival 2026.
